{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 15-year-old girl with primary amenorrhea, breast development, sparse pubic hair, and bilateral inguinal masses. The absence of a uterus and ovaries on ultrasonography suggests a diagnosis of Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser (MRKH) syndrome, which is characterized by congenital absence of the uterus and upper two-thirds of the vagina. The most appropriate treatment for MRKH syndrome is vaginal dilatory therapy to stretch the vaginal pouch and create a functional vagina.", "answer_choice": "C"}
